author: Anonym
title: Premier League: Arsenal fall to West Ham and miss chance to take the lead - The Limited Times
text:
A small feat for West Ham and a setback for the Gunners! By winning (0-2) at the Emirates Stadium, Alphonse Areola and his teammates stunned Arsenal on Thursday evening, at the end of the 19th day of the Premier League.
The Gunners needed to win to move ahead of Liverpool, take the lead in the league and at the same time distance Manchester City and Unai Emery's Aston Villa. But Mikel Arteta's men lacked realism as evidenced by the statistics of the match: 74.2% possession in their favour, 30 shots including eight on target, compared to only six including three on target for their opponents.
Against them, the West Ham players were able to be opportunistic by scoring at the start of the first half on a counter initiated by former Lyon player Lucas Paqueta and finished by Tomas Soucek (13‚Ä≤). The referees hesitated to validate it, checking if the ball had not gone out to the left of the goal on the pass before the goal but ended up awarding it.
In the second half, it was from a corner and thanks to a header from a former Arsenal player, Konstantinos Mavropanos, well helped by the post and the crossbar (55'), that West Ham made the break. The Hammers could even have finished off their opponents with a penalty in the dying seconds, saved by David Raya.
Mavropanos bends Arsenal again! üî¥
The former Gunner's header hits the bar and then the post before going into goal and it's 2-0 for West Ham ‚öíÔ∏è #WHUARS | #PremierLeague pic.twitter.com/skos017mBc
‚Äî CANAL+ Foot (@CanalplusFoot) December 28, 2023
Tottenham end their run at Brighton Having struggled away from home in recent weeks, the Hammers have made a very good move in the race for European qualification. West Ham are in sixth place in the Premier League table thanks to this win and are ahead of Manchester United.
Earlier in the evening, the other match of this 19th matchday of the Premier League saw Brighton surprise Tottenham in a very fast-paced match (4-2). Spurs, who were on a three-game winning streak, were unable to catch up after two goals from Jack Hinshelwood (11') and Joao Pedro (23' from the penalty spot).
They lost all hope after third and fourth goals from Pervis Estupinan (63‚Ä≤) and Joao Pedro (75‚Ä≤, again from the penalty spot), despite the reductions of the score by Alejo Veliz (81‚Ä≤) and Ben Davies (85‚Ä≤). Tottenham are in fifth place in the table.

author: TOI World Desk
title: NASA's solar dynamics observatory captures spectacular X5.0 Solar flare on New Year's Eve - Times of India
text: NASA's Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO) has once again captured a stunning glimpse into the dynamic activity of our Sun, capturing a powerful X5.0 solar flare on the last day of 2023. The image, released by NASA on its blog page, showcases the intense burst of energy in extreme ultraviolet light, vividly colorized in yellow and orange.Solar flares are potent releases of energy from the Sun's surface, capable of impacting various aspects of modern technology. The bright flash on the far left of the image represents the eruption, emphasizing the extremely hot material involved in flares.The X-class classification assigned to this solar flare designates it as one of the most intense types, with the number 5.0 providing additional information about its strength. The implications of such flares extend beyond their visual appeal; they can influence radio communications, disrupt electric power grids, interfere with navigation signals, and pose potential risks to both spacecraft and astronauts.As part of the nation's space weather efforts, NASA operates as a crucial research arm, tirelessly monitoring the Sun and our space environment. The agency employs a fleet of spacecraft dedicated to studying various aspects, from the Sun's activity and solar atmosphere to the particles and magnetic fields in the space surrounding Earth.

author: AB Newswire
title: Invest Wealth Summit 2024: Breaking Free From Wall Street In San Diego | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
San Diego, CA - March 14, 2024 - Dutch Mendenhall , renowned alternative investment thought leader and bestselling author, will lead the Invest Wealth Summit (IWS) in San Diego from April 19 to 21, 2024.
This exclusive event, tailored for investors, entrepreneurs, and newcomers, promises unmatched insights and networking opportunities to Redefine the American Dream . Dutch challenges individuals facing economic uncertainties, particularly in California, stating, "There is a viable alternative to conventional financial strategies, and I‚Äôve done it since 2008."
Key Highlights:
Is California real estate out of reach? Think again. Discover hidden gems in California's volatile real estate market.
Sick of California's sky-high taxes? So are we. Arm yourself with battle-tested tactics to slash your tax bill and shield your assets.
Don't let California's steep living costs hold you back. Learn to outpace inflation with passive income streams and improve your freedom mobility , as it will be discussed at IWS.
It‚Äôs time to take action, and IWS will have the resources. Dutch and industry-leading guest speakers will be there to share their expertise, offering due diligence training, exclusive access to unique deals, expert asset protection and tax incentives strategies, and other experts within the field.
Break free from the traditional status quo at the Invest Wealth Summit. Registration is open at InvestWealthSummit.com

author: Devan McGuinness
title: Matty Matheson Helps Parents Make A Giant Breakfast In 25 Minutes For Their Impatient Kids
text:
Breakfast Time! Watch This Star Of 'The Bear' Whip Up A Giant, Kid-Friendly Breakfast In 25 Minutes Celebrity chef Matty Matheson will give you divine breakfast inspiration. And make you laugh.
by Devan McGuinness Jan. 5, 2024
Kevin Winter/Getty Images Entertainment/Getty Images It‚Äôs Sunday morning. The kids are stirring. It‚Äôs way too early. And they have a demand: They want pancakes, bacon, and eggs, and they want them now. Look no further than a recent video from Matty Matheson ‚Äî the Canadian professional chef, star of The Bear, and host of the popular cooking YouTube series, Cookin‚Äô Somethin‚Äô. On December 31, the dad of three revealed his secret to getting a big Sunday breakfast on the table fast: a meal that serves five to 10 people and is done in less than half an hour.
‚ÄúI'm going to show you what I make every single Sunday breakfast,‚Äù he shared in his hilariously salty video . ‚ÄúI can't take an hour [to cook food]. You got three kids screaming at you: ‚ÄúI'M DYYYYING!‚Äù
The virtues of the meal for parents are easy to see right away: There‚Äôs no ‚Äúcutting, there‚Äôs no chopping, there‚Äôs no nothing,‚Äù and it ends with a ‚Äúcrispy and gooey and lovely‚Äù meal. The breakfast is a feast of eggs, toast, beans, bacon, sausage, pancakes. Yum.
First, Matheson gets the hash browns going in his air fryer ‚Äî since they‚Äôll take the longest to cook. Then, he reveals a bacon-cooking hack where he cooks the bacon all at once in a cross-hatch pattern in the pan. With this method, the steam renders the bacon, and eventually, with some more prodding and stirring, that meat just crisps up.
Or, as he puts it, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs called cooking. Do I still have to explain what cooking is?‚Äù
Then, he gets the sausages in the pan going ‚Äî because they‚Äôre just going to ‚Äúhang out,‚Äù and while they hang out, it‚Äôs time to think about music, says Matheson. ‚ÄúYou want some nice softies‚Ä¶ a little Joan Baez‚Ä¶ a little Joni, if you want.‚Äù
The 25-minute meal requires some juggling: He throws a can of beans in a pot, makes pancake mix, drops maple syrup in the sausage, checks on the bacon, and cooks up the pancakes all at the same time. Then he makes eggs ‚Äî scrambling them ‚Äî while flipping pancakes and stirring up the cross-hatched, steamed bacon to ensure that the bacon is slowly crisping in the pan.
Last but not least, Matheson toasts the bread, and in 25 minutes, he‚Äôs got a fast-and-furious, massive breakfast on the table.
It‚Äôs a hilariously busy 10-minute video, but not so busy that Matheson can‚Äôt find a minute to complain about his children while wrangling a handful of different pots and pans on the stovetop: ‚ÄúNobody‚Äôs even watching,‚Äù he jokes about his cooking tour-de-force. ‚ÄúNobody‚Äôs even caring. They‚Äôre all on their iPads, disillusioned... Mac‚Äôs buying $300 video games and he doesn‚Äôt even know. And he‚Äôs always like, ‚ÄòMom, can I get this one?‚Äô... What a jabroni,‚Äù he jokes.
Funny and entertaining as it is, Matheson‚Äôs video offers seriously helpful tips and tricks for whipping up a big, successful family meal fast. It‚Äôs a model of inspirational multi-tasking that most parents will relate to, as they break a sweat toggling between tasks in a crazy-making way that makes you want to tear off your shirt and swear profusely. Or maybe that‚Äôs just Matheson.
Sundays don‚Äôt always call for elaborate breakfast spreads. Just ask Top Chef winner Joe Flamm . In a recent edition of The Dad Special , he shared a relatable anecdote about the importance of flexibility when it comes to making your kids food: ‚ÄúToday, my son Luca woke up and said, ‚ÄòI want eggies and tortillas.‚Äô So I thought, OK, cool. We're all having breakfast tacos with eggs,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúSo, I whipped that up, and everyone was happy. And then there are times when they‚Äôre just like, ‚ÄòI want to eat six tubes of yogurt.‚Äô And this is what we‚Äôre doing.‚Äù
Not subscribed to Fatherly‚Äôs newsletter yet? We‚Äôre not mad, just disappointed.

author: Jogada10
title: Satisfeito com refor√ßos do Botafogo, Textor analisa: ‚ÄòBom desafio‚Äô
text:
John Textor, acionista majorit√°rio da Saf Botafogo, mostrou-se satisfeito com as contrata√ß√µes do Alvinegro nesta janela de transfer√™ncias. Oito jogadores chegaram para refor√ßar a equipe no restante da temporada. Assim, em entrevista ao ‚ÄúCanal do TF‚Äù, no Youtube, empres√°rio avaliou que a equipe est√° bem servida em todas as posi√ß√µes.
‚ÄúEstamos cheios de jogadores, preenchemos todas as lacunas na equipe, trouxemos um ataque forte, mais adi√ß√µes ao meio-campo, que j√° era forte. Temos um excelente jogador de desenvolvimento na linha traseira, Alexander Barboza tem estado muito bem recentemente. Fortalecemos a defesa incrivelmente‚Äù, avaliou.
O Botafogo fechou a janela com o maior investimento da hist√≥ria do clube: R$ 231 milh√µes. Com as chegadas de Allan, Igor Jesus, Thiago Almada, Mohamed Al Arouch, Matheus Martins, Vitinho, Adryelson e AlexTelles, o elenco ficou ainda mais recheado de jogadores experientes. Dessa forma, Textor v√™ como um bom desafio para o treinador Artur Jorge conseguir montar o time ideal.
Siga nosso conte√∫do nas redes sociais: Bluesky, Threads, Twitter, Instagram e Facebook .

author: Beatrice Raso
title: Clima: dalle rinnovabili al buco dell‚Äôozono, ecco 5 notizie positive del 2023
text:
MeteoWeb ¬ª CLIMATOLOGIA Clima: dalle rinnovabili al buco dell‚Äôozono, ecco 5 notizie positive del 2023 Nel 2023, il mondo ha celebrato una delle sue pi√π grandi vittorie ambientali: ecco le 5 notizie positive sul clima dell'anno appena concluso di Beatrice Raso 2 Gen 2024 | 20:41 MeteoWeb Nel 2023, non sono mancate le notizie cupe sul clima: il caldo a livello globale ha alimentato eventi meteorologici estremi mortali, gli scienziati hanno lanciato avvertimenti terribili sul fatto che il prossimo anno potrebbe essere ancora peggio e l‚Äôinquinamento da carbonio del mondo ha continuato ad aumentare. Ma in mezzo a queste tristi notizie, ci sono stati anche segnali di progresso: per esempio, sono stati stabiliti record di energia rinnovabile e il mondo ha celebrato una delle sue pi√π grandi vittorie ambientali. Vediamo le 5 notizie sul clima del 2023 per sentirsi positivi.
Un‚Äôimpennata delle energie rinnovabili Nel 2023, ci sono stati alcuni punti positivi sull‚Äôenergia green in tutto il mondo. Ad Halloween, il Portogallo ha iniziato una serie da record: per pi√π di sei giorni consecutivi, tra il 31 ottobre e il 6 novembre, la nazione di oltre 10 milioni di persone ha fatto affidamento esclusivamente su fonti energetiche rinnovabili . Secondo l‚ÄôAgenzia internazionale per l‚Äôenergia, l‚Äôanno 2023 potrebbe vedere il pi√π grande aumento della capacit√† di energia rinnovabile fino ad oggi.
La Cina , il pi√π grande inquinatore del mondo, ha fatto progressi nel campo delle energie rinnovabili, con il Paese destinato a raggiungere il suo obiettivo su eolico e solare con cinque anni di anticipo. Un rapporto pubblicato a giugno ha rilevato che la capacit√† solare della Cina √® ora maggiore di quella del resto delle nazioni del mondo messe insieme, in un aumento descritto dall‚Äôautore del rapporto, Global Energy Monitor, come ‚Äú sbalorditivo ‚Äù.
Non si pu√≤ ignorare, tuttavia, che quest‚Äôanno la Cina ha anche aumentato la produzione di carbone , ricorrendo ai combustibili fossili mentre feroci ondate di caldo aumentavano la domanda di energia per il condizionamento e il raffreddamento, e mentre la persistente siccit√† nel sud del Paese incideva sulle forniture idroelettriche che dipendono da precipitazioni sufficienti. Si sperava che la produzione di carbone del Paese raggiungesse il picco per poi scendere presto, quando la Cina e gli Stati Uniti a novembre hanno annunciato che avrebbero ripreso la cooperazione sul cambiamento climatico , promettendo un forte aumento delle energie rinnovabili, in particolare per sostituire i combustibili fossili. Un accordo sui combustibili fossili
Dopo pi√π di due settimane di difficili negoziati, il vertice sul clima COP28 di Dubai si √® concluso a dicembre con quasi 200 Paesi che hanno assunto un impegno senza precedenti per abbandonare i combustibili fossili . Anche se l‚Äôaccordo non ha richiesto al mondo di eliminare gradualmente carbone, petrolio e gas ‚Äì posizione che pi√π di 100 Paesi avevano sostenuto ‚Äì ha invitato i Paesi a ‚Äú contribuire ‚Äù a una ‚Äú transizione dai combustibili fossili nei sistemi energetici‚Äù . Ci√≤ ha segnato la prima volta che tutti i combustibili fossili sono stati citati in un accordo COP.
Il Presidente della COP28 Sultan Al Jaber ha definito l‚Äôaccordo ‚Äú storico ‚Äù, aggiungendo che rappresenta ‚Äú un cambio di paradigma che ha il potenziale per ridefinire le nostre economie ‚Äù. L‚Äôimpatto finale di questo accordo dipender√† da ci√≤ che i Paesi faranno per attuarlo. Molti esperti hanno messo in guardia dalle lacune che potrebbero lasciare la porta aperta a una continua espansione dei combustibili fossili. Ma il fatto che sia stato raggiunto un accordo sui combustibili fossili √® stato ampiamente accolto con favore e visto come una svolta. CLIMATOLOGIA ‚ÄúStorico‚Äù o ‚Äúdebole‚Äù? L‚Äôanalisi dell‚Äôaccordo sul clima della COP28

author: Sarah Menanix
title: Gluten-Free Pumpkin Pie Bars
text:
Enjoy the flavors of homemade gluten-free pumpkin pie without the hassle of rolling out a crust! With a creamy spiced pumpkin filling atop a buttery gluten-free shortbread or graham cracker crust, these pumpkin pie bars offer the best of classic pie in an easy-to-make, easy-to-serve treat that‚Äôs perfect for any fall gathering.
QUICK LINKS: Crust Options | Recipe FAQ
I've recently learned that there are two types of pumpkin pie lovers: those who want whipped cream with their pumpkin pie and those who want pumpkin pie with their whipped cream. It's a subtle difference, but I suspect the people who prefer mountains of whipped cream hiding their pie haven't ever had anything as crowd-pleasing as these gluten-free pumpkin pie bars.
The custardy creamy filling is so rich and velvety that it doesn't need loads of whipped cream. A dollop will do to bring out the classic nostalgic flavor.
This recipe was inspired by my classic gluten-free dairy-free pumpkin pie tart , but in an easy-to-serve bar. You can make these bars dairy-full or dairy-free and they'll wow your friends either way!
Why you'll love this recipe Quick and easy to make : This recipe requires just one bowl‚Äîuse the same bowl for the crust and the filling. The crust is pressed into a pan, parbaked, and the filling ingredients are whisked together, poured into the pan and baked. Creamy velvety texture : The filling is so silky smooth and creamy! Full of fall flavor : With plenty of spices, each bite tastes like fall. Uses an entire can of pumpkin : No waste, no need to save part of a can of pumpkin you may never use. Serves a crowd : This recipe makes 16 bars, so it's perfect for a crowd! Ingredients for Gluten-free Pumpkin Pie Bars For these gluten-free pumpkin pie bars, you can opt for a lightly sweetened buttery shortbread crust made with almond flour (my go-to!) or make it even easier by using a gluten-free graham cracker crust . The former has a more classic pumpkin pie flavor, while the latter offers convenience.
The custardy pumpkin filling uses simple ingredients and can easily be made dairy-free!
Here's your shopping list:
Pumpkin Pie Filling :
Light brown sugar Granulated sugar Cornstarch Spices: cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice, cloves, salt Large eggs Canned pumpkin pur√©e: This recipe uses a whole 15oz can of pumpkin pur√©e ( Not pumpkin pie filling). Heavy cream: Or, for a dairy-free version, use canned full-fat coconut milk. Vanilla extract Gluten-Free Shortbread Crust
Superfine blanched almond flour Sweet rice flour: Also called mochiko or glutinous rice flour, sweet rice flour is the same flour used to make mochi. It is distinctly different than white rice flour or brown rice flour. I recommend Koda Farms brand . Sweet rice flour is the sticky "glue" that holds the crust together so it doesn't crumble. Cornstarch : Cornstarch keeps the crust crisp and snappy. Granulated sugar Ground cinnamon Kosher salt Unsalted butter Vanilla extract OR 1 Gluen-free Graham Cracker Crust
Visit the recipe card for exact quantities!
How to Make Easy Gluten-Free Pumpkin Pie Bars These gluten-free pumpkin bars can either be made in a single mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer. You don't even need to wipe the bowl out between making the crust and the filling. They're a great no-fuss pumpkin pie treat!
Making the Crust Either make an almond-flour shortbread crust or a gluten-free graham cracker crust - your choice! Use a stand mixer or use a large mixing bowl with a silicone spatula.
Start by lining an 8x8 or 9x9 square baking pan with parchment paper.
For the gluten-free shortbread crust, mix the dry ingredients.
Add the softened butter and vanilla.
Mix until the butter is fully incorporated and the dough clumps when pinched. You can use a stand mixer or do this with a silicone spatula.
Dump the crumbs into the prepared baking pan.
Press the dough into the pan, using your hands or a flat measuring up to flatten it until it is even and compact
Chill while you preheat the oven. Dock the crust all over with the tines of a fork.
Par-bake the crust for 18 minutes. When it comes out of the oven, use a measuring cup or the bottom of a glass to press the crust down compactly.
Alternatively, prepare and bake a gluten-free graham cracker crust .
Making the Filling While to crust is baking, prepare the filling in the same bowl, either a stand mixer or a large mixing bowl with a whisk. No need to wash the bowl, just wipe it out a bit.
Combine the sugars, corn starch, and spices.
Whisk together.
Add pumpkin, heavy cream, eggs, and vanilla.
Pour the filling into the par-baked crust.
Bake until the center is no longer jiggly. 45-50 minutes for an 8x8 pan or 40-45 minutes for a 9x9 pan. Let cool and chill before slicing.
Tip : To ensure your bars are fully set, they need to cool completely before transferring to the fridge to chill for at least an hour.
Shortbread Crust versus Graham Cracker Crust I've developed this recipe to work with a homemade gluten-free shortbread crust as well as a gluten-free graham cracker crust . Both are delicious, and whether you choose one over the other is your preference of flavor, baking skill required, and time.
The almond flour shortbread crust is thicker with a crisp bottom. Lightly sweetened, the flavor is much more reminiscent of classic pumpkin pie. While it requires more ingredients and moderately more skill, the flavor and texture pay off is worth it! This crust also stays crisp under the moist pumpkin pie filling for multiple days.
The gluten-free graham cracker crust requires just a couple of ingredients, one of which is store-bought gluten-free graham crackers. It comes together super quickly and is essentially foolproof. The sweetness depends on the specific graham crackers you buy, so it can taste sweeter than the shortbread crust. The flavor of the graham cracker crust is more dominant and pronounces, but it still pairs well with the pumpkin custard filling. Due to its more porous texture, the graham cracker crust tends to stay crisp only for a day or two after it's been baked under the moist filling.
Heavy Cream versus Evaporated Milk Filling While many pumpkin pie recipes call for evaporated milk, I recommend heavy cream as it creates a creamy and luxurious texture. The richness of heavy cream enhances the overall flavor, creating a richer mouthfeel. That being said, evaporated milk will work too!
For a dairy-free version, see below!
Tip for Crisp Crust The longer pumpkin pie bars are stored, the more likely the moisture from the custard filling will begin to soften the crust. I typically bake my pumpkin pie bars the day before I plan to serve them, chilling them overnight.
Pumpkin Pie Many Ways If you're looking for a more classic pumpkin pie, try my gluten-free pumpkin pie ! Or you can go crustless and try my crustless pumpkin pie with pecan topping . And if you need a vegan pumpkin pie , I've got you covered too!
Recipe FAQ What kind of pan to use for pumpkin pie bars? For these bars, you can use any metal or glass 8x8 or 9x9 baking dish. If using a 8x8 baking dish, the bars will be thicker as pictured above with the shortbread crust. If using a 9x9 baking dish, the bars will be thinner as in the pictures above with the graham cracker crust, and will need to bake for 5 minutes less.
Can you Make Dairy-Free Gluten-Free Pumpkin Pie Bars Yes! To make these pumpkin pie bars dairy-free, simply substitute the heavy cream in the filling for canned full-fat coconut milk. For the crust, use the dairy-free option of graham cracker crust or use refined coconut oil or stick plant butter in place of the butter in the shortbread crust.
How to store gluten-free pumpkin dessert bars Store any leftovers covered with plastic wrap or in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.
More Gluten-Free Fall Desserts Here are a few of my favorite gluten-free fall desserts to make this month!
Vanilla Bean Pear Persimmon Pie Pumpkin Gluten-Free Vegan Bread Pudding Gluten-Free Pumpkin Muffins Chewy Gluten-Free Pumpkin Cookies Recipe Gluten-Free Pumpkin Pie Bars yields: 16 bars prep time: 10 minutes mins cook time: 1 hour hr 5 minutes mins total time: 1 hour hr 15 minutes mins Enjoy the flavors of homemade gluten-free pumpkin pie without the hassle of rolling out a crust! With a creamy spiced pumpkin filling atop a buttery gluten-free shortbread or graham cracker crust, these pumpkin pie bars offer the best of classic pie in an easy-to-make, easy-to-serve treat that‚Äôs perfect for any fall gathering. No reviews yet
PRINT
PIN SAVE Saved! Ingredients Gluten-Free Shortbread Crust ‚ñ¢ 105 g ( ¬æ cup + 3 tablespoons ) super-fine blanched almond flour ‚ñ¢ 60 g ( ¬º cup + 2 tablespoons ) sweet rice flour , Also called "mochiko", distinctly different than white rice flour or brown rice flour ‚ñ¢ 63 g ( ¬º cup + 1 tablespoon ) granulated sugar ‚ñ¢ 17 g ( 2 tablespoons ) cornstarch ‚ñ¢ ¬æ teaspoon ground cinnamon ‚ñ¢ ‚Öõ teaspoon kosher salt ‚ñ¢ 6 tablespoons ( 85 g ) unsalted butter , softened ‚ñ¢ ¬æ teaspoon pure vanilla extract or Gluten-Free Graham Cracker Crust ‚ñ¢ 1 gluten-free graham cracker crust , baked in an 8x8 or 9x9 baking pan Pumpkin Pie Filling ‚ñ¢ ¬Ω cup light brown sugar ‚ñ¢ ¬º tablespoons granulated sugar ‚ñ¢ ¬Ω tablespoon cornstarch ‚ñ¢ ¬Ω teaspoon ground cinnamon ‚ñ¢ ¬º teaspoon ground ginger ‚ñ¢ ¬º teaspoon ground nutmeg ‚ñ¢ ‚Öõ teaspoon ground allspice ‚ñ¢ ‚Öõ teaspoon ground cloves ‚ñ¢ ¬º teaspoon kosher salt ‚ñ¢ 15 oz canned pumpkin , NOT pumpkin pie filling, preferrably not organic (see note) ‚ñ¢ ¬æ cup heavy cream , or canned evaporated milk or canned coconut milk ‚ñ¢ 2 large eggs ‚ñ¢ 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract Cook Mode Prevent your screen from going dark INSTRUCTIONS Line an 8x8 or 9x9 square baking pan with parchment paper. Prepare the crust - either gluten-free graham cracker crust or gluten-free shortbread crust. For the gluten-free shortbread crust, mix together the almond flour, sweet rice flour, corn starch, cinnamon, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or a large mixing bowl with a silicone spatula. Add the softened butter and vanilla and mix on medium-low until the butter is fully incorporated and the dough clumps when pinched. Dump the crumbs into the prepared baking pan and press them out evenly into the pan, using your hands or a flat measuring up to flatten it until it is even and compact. Chill for 10 minutes while you preheat the oven to 350¬∞F. Dock the crust all over with the tines of a fork. Par bake the crust for 18 minutes. When it comes out of the oven, use a measuring cup or the bottom of a glass to press the crust down compactly. While to crust is baking, prepare the filling in the same bowl, either a stand mixer or a large mixing bowl with a whisk. No need to wash the bowl, just wipe it out a bit. Whisk together the sugars, corn starch, and spices. Add the pumpkin, heavy cream, eggs, and vanilla and whisk until completely smooth. Pour the filling into the par-baked crust and bake until the center is no longer jiggly. 45-50 minutes for a 8x8 pan and 40-45 minutes for a 9x9 pan. Once baked, let cool at room temperature before transferring to the fridge to chill for at least an hour. Notes Canned Pumpkin: I recommend non-organic canned pumpkin as organic canned pumpkin tends to have a lot higher moisture content which can negatively affect the outcome of a recipe. Did you make this recipe? Please leave a review and rating to let me and others know how you liked it!
